text: Physicist Albert Einstein’s theory of relativity proposed that space and time are interconnected, forming a flexible “fabric” affected by gravity, which revolutionized our understanding of the universe.
text2: Physicist Isaac Newton’s earlier work described gravity as a force acting at a distance between objects with mass, a simpler model that assumed space and time were absolute and unchanging.
question: Based on the texts, how would Newton (Text 2) likely respond to Einstein’s (Text 1) theory of relativity? Provide reasoning for your answer.
A: By arguing that space and time are absolute and unaffected by external forces.
B: By agreeing that space and time are flexible concepts affected by gravity.
C: By claiming that gravity is irrelevant to the structure of space-time.
D: By suggesting that relativity provides no new insights into gravity.
explanation: B is the best answer. Newton’s model assumed space and time were fixed and unaffected by gravity, contrasting with Einstein’s idea of a flexible space-time fabric.Choice A is incorrect; Newton did not view space and time as flexible.Choice C is incorrect; Newton’s theory focuses on gravity’s effect, though as a force.Choice D is incorrect; relativity offers a new framework that Newton did not propose.
